name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course will examine different text types and acquaint students with the techniques and methodologies available in translating these texts. Attention will not only be given to usage, but also to issues of discourse. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.

materials:
Teaching Materials:
1. instructor’s lecture handouts
2. selected readings from the following books:
《文體與翻譯》（劉宓慶）、《翻譯初階》（周兆祥）、《傳媒翻譯》（鄭寶璇）、《新聞翻譯：原則與方法》（李德鳳）、An Encyclopaedia of translation: Chinese-English, English-Chinese (Chan, S. and D. Pollard ed.)
Requirements & Rules:
1. Please turn off your cell phone during the two-hour class period.
2. Absence: Students are expected to attend the class ON TIME.
(1) Being late for more than TWENTY minutes equals one hour unexcused absence. One hour UNEXCUSED absence results in 4 points deduction.
(2) For an absence to be excused, students need to submit compelling evidence of the gravity or unforseeability of the event causing the absence within ONE WEEK.
(3) Students missing more than 6 hours unexcused will have a fail.
(4) Absence from a class is no excuse for not knowing the assignment and what has been discussed in that class. There will be NO MAKE-UP EXAM unless you have valid and official reasons for absence BEFOREHAND.
3. Assignments:
(1) Translation assignments will be given periodically throughout the course. All translation assignments have to be typed. Further details concerning the format will be provided in
Week 3.
(2) Each assignment goes through the following stages: (a) submission of the first draft by due date, (b) discussion of assignment in class, and (c) submission of the second draft, which will be evaluated.
(3) All assignments must be submitted via e-mail by 5PM SUNDAY. For late assignments, 20% of the assignment mark will be deducted each day. Assignments more than THREE days late will not be accepted
4. Pre-readings: Students must complete the assigned pre-readings prior to the class session. All articles covered by the pre-readings are included in the in-class quizzes and final exam.
